### What?
This PR fixes an issue where the `font-family` declaration in
`next/font/local` is ignored when specified in `declarations`.

### Why?
Currently, Next.js forces the generated variable name instead of
respecting the provided `font-family`.
This change ensures that when `font-family` is explicitly set in
`declarations`, it is correctly applied in the generated `@font-face`
CSS.

### How?
- Updated `loader.ts` to respect the `font-family` declaration if
explicitly defined.
- Removed the restriction on `font-family` in
`validate-local-font-function-call.ts`.
- Added tests:
- `loader.test.ts`: Ensures the `font-family` is correctly used when
declared.
- `validate-local-font-function-call.test.ts`: Confirms that
`font-family` is now an allowed declaration.

Closes NEXT-
Fixes #75898
